V. Diceware Password Generator API Reference¶

The “generator” module¶

This python module generates n diceware passwords of length l, where l denotes the number of words in the diceware password. This module assumes that the ‘haveged’ package is installed on your linux system, as it provides excellent entropy.

src.generator.generate(n, l)[source]¶

This method prints n diceware passwords of length l.

Parameters:
  • n (int) – the number of generated diceware passwords
  • l (int) – the length of a diceware password
Returns:

prints to the console n diceware passwords of length l
src.generator.password(l)[source]¶

This method returns a diceware password string of l words.

This method samples cryptographically secure random integers using the linux coreutils shuf package. One of the requirements for this module is that the haveged package is installed as it allows /dev/random’s entropy pool to never dip below ~1024 bits.

Parameters:l (int) – the length of a diceware password
Returns:str representing a diceware password of length l
